Author: Alright#0419
Content: you would want to send the full balance of each to a single address

Author: Alright#0419
Content: then send it again to combine the UTXOs

Author: CryptoCurb#3284
Content: @Alright By "send it again" do you mean send the combined KMD to another address?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: yes

Author: Alright#0419
Content: or the same address

Author: Alright#0419
Content: basically once you combine the two, you will have multiple UTXOs sitting in the same address. If any of these UTXOs are <10 KMD, they won't accrue rewards

Author: Cranky#9935
Content: Under a different seed I had sent 3000 CRDS, none of which showed up. Created a new seed and sent 6 CRDS (3 x 2 CRDS) but no change

Author: cipi#4502
Content:
and you are sure that BarterDEX can talk to the wallet?
wallet listens to the default rpc port and has rpcusername and rpcpassword set
this is my config that works
```server=1
txindex=1
litemode=1
listen=0
listenonion=0
rpcuser=bartercrds
rpcpassword=whatever```

Author: Cranky#9935
Content: There is no reason that it can't

Author: Cranky#9935
Content: it's on the same computer

Author: cipi#4502
Content:
and  `netstat -ntlp | grep creditsd` is showing me
```tcp        0      0 127.0.0.1:31050         0.0.0.0:*               LISTEN      29207/creditsd
tcp6       0      0 ::1:31050               :::*                    LISTEN      29207/creditsd```

Author: Cranky#9935
Content: running as the same user

Author: cipi#4502
Content: yes, but the wallet needs to listen to port 31050

Author: cipi#4502
Content: if it does not, BarterDEX can't connect to it and can't show balance

Author: cipi#4502
Content: if you don't have `server=1` in your config, then the wallet will not listen to the rpcport 31050, for example

Author: Cranky#9935
Content: ah, I'm missing server=1 I think

Author: cipi#4502
Content: or if the port is in use when you start the wallet, it will not bind to that port with the same result... best is to check if the creditsd is indeed listening to that port

Author: Cranky#9935
Content: I moved my BarterDEX from my PC to my VPS and likely forgot to add server=1. Adding now and restarting everything

Content: I have got stuck funds in Barterdex at the moment, because the version I have is depreciated. Author: SHossain#0007
Content: Your funds are tied up with your seed phrase or WIF key. just use the seed phrase to login into Agama and you will be able to access your funds in there.
